intro: Ipomoea cucullata, commonly known as the hooded morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and climbing habit. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Ipomoea cucullata is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
